JUDGES: André Potocki;Angelika Nußberger;Ann Power-Forde;Dean Spielmann;Elisabet Fura;Ganna Yudkivska
TEXT: The applicant , Mr Borys Vasylyovych Bashchenko , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
On DATE the applicant lodged a civil claim with ORG against ORG , seeking to be issued title to a plot of land to which he was entitled as a member of the NORP collective farm .

On DATE the court found against the applicant , determining that there was no evidence that the applicant was on the list of those entitled to a plot of land on the NORP farm . It noted in particular that the decision of the NORP farm management of CARDINAL DATE did not prove the applicant ’s entitlement to a plot of land .
On DATE ORG upheld the decision of the first - instance court .

On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal on points of law with ORG . In his appeal the applicant requested an extension of the time - limit for lodging the appeal , without indicating any reasons for the request .
On DATE the applicant lodged a supplement to his appeal of CARDINAL DATE , in which he also requested an extension of the time - limit without indicating any reasons for the delay .
On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal as out of time , noting that the applicant had not requested an extension of the timelimit for lodging the appeal .

On DATE the applicant sent a letter to ORG pointing out that he had included a request for an extension in his appeal . In reply , the court repeatedly informed the applicant that his appeal had been rejected as out of time , as it contained no request for an extension .
“ CARDINAL . An appeal on points of law may be lodged within DATE of the date of entry into force of the decision ( ruling ) of the court of appeal .

CARDINAL . NORP If the time - limit set forth in paragraph one of this LAW is not respected for reasons which have been found valid , a cassation court judge may renew the timelimit at the request of the person who lodged the appeal .

CARDINAL . An appeal on points of law which has been lodged outside the time - limit for such an appeal shall be returned to the person who has lodged it , if that person has not raised the issue of renewal of the time - limit , or if renewal of the time - limit has been refused .
CARDINAL . Renewal of the time - limit for an appeal on points of law and return of an appeal on points of law shall be decided by a judge rapporteur , who will issue a ruling in this respect . ”

CARDINAL . A judge rapporteur shall return an appeal on points of law lodged outside the time - limit for such an appeal to the person who lodged it , unless he or she requests the renewal of the time - limit ... ”
